pull.title: Fix various edge case bugs in QValidatedLineEdit
pull.body:
1. Use a CSS selector to avoid changing the background colour of the tooltip.
2. Re-check validity of input when we first set the validator (probably a no-op in practice).
3. Check validity of input when it is set programmatically via `setText` (eg, via the address book). Probably no-op in practice UNTIL merging #15987 or any other PR that adds a warning for valid addresses.

events.message: Bugfix: GUI: Only apply invalid style to QValidatedLineEdit, not its tooltip
Bugfix: GUI: Re-check validity after QValidatedLineEdit::setCheckValidator
Bugfix: GUI: Check validity when QValidatedLineEdit::setText is called

events.body: A couple of Concept ACKs here, but no other comments for 6 months. Also seems that the 3rd commit is still a no-op (along with probably the second commit?), and #15987 has now been closed. I'm going to suggest re-opening in the [GUI repo](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui).

comments.body: I don't know why it would be unwanted.

b1a544be109d336c0b53722e3f8b51687972c94e

@hebasto don't understand what side effect you are talking about nor why you point to that code, `setValidator()` is not called.

aeb18b665c616c3326671b4c7e9d6421306564f0

Maybe drop this and add in the constructor:
```cpp
connect(this, &QValidatedLineEdit::textChanged, this, &QValidatedLineEdit::checkValidity);
```
Then it will run `checkValidity` twice for every keystroke?
